hints.content:
The area is the amount of flat space a shape takes up. 

We can find the area by counting the number of unit squares that the shape covers.

$\blueD{\text{Figure A}}$ has an area of $\blueD{7}$ square units.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 4 rows and 2 columns of 7 unit squares connected together on a grid. First, second, and fourth rows from the top have 2 unit squares each and the third row from the top has 1 unit square. The unit squares that make up shape A are labeled 1 through 7. Shape B with 2 rows and 5 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top row has 3 unit squares and the bottom row has 5 unit squares. !

hints.content:
$\maroonD{\text{Figure B}}$ has an area of $\maroonD{8}$ square units.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 4 rows and 2 columns of 7 unit squares connected together on a grid. First, second, and fourth rows from the top have 2 unit squares each and the third row from the top has 1 unit square. Shape B with 2 rows and 5 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top row has 3 unit squares and the bottom row has 5 unit squares. The unit squares that make up shape B are labeled 1 through 8. !

hints.content:
Figure $\blueD{\text{A}}$ covers *fewer* unit squares on the grid than figure $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

So, the area of figure $\blueD{\text{A}}$ is *less* than the area of figure $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

question.content:
Each square in the grid is a unit square with an area of $1$ square unit.  

**Fill in the blanks.**

Figure $\blueD{\text{A}}$ covers [[☃ dropdown 1]] unit squares on the grid than figure $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.

So, the area of figure $\blueD{\text{A}}$ is  [[☃ dropdown 2]]  than the area of figure $\maroonD{\text{B}}$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A grid with 2 shapes of different sizes labeled A and B. Shape A with 4 rows and 2 columns of 7 unit squares connected together on a grid. First, second, and fourth rows from the top have 2 unit squares each and the third row from the top has 1 unit square. Shape B with 2 rows and 5 columns of 8 unit squares connected together on a grid. The top row has 3 unit squares and the bottom row has 5 unit squares. !
